metadata.subject: Donald Trump Used Legally Dubious Method to Avoid Paying Taxes

relationships.description: Trump references Clinton's Senate record during campaign rally
Trump borrowed and lost money from investors and banks for casino empire

analysis.purpose: To expose Donald Trump's tax avoidance strategies and their legal implications
analysis.significance: Reveals Trump used legally questionable tax maneuvers to avoid paying federal income taxes while losing investors' money

concerns: IRS likely to declare improper if audited
Trampled core tenets of American tax policy

notable_quotes: "Why didn't she ever try to change those laws so I couldn't use them?" - Donald Trump
"Whatever loophole existed was not 'exploited' here, but stretched beyond any recognition" - Steven M. Rosenthal
red_flags: Use of legally dubious tax maneuvers
Avoiding taxes while losing investors' money
Breaking presidential candidate tradition of releasing tax returns

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion found in this news article

illegal_activity.description: This is a New York Times news article reporting on Trump's tax practices, not first-hand evidence of illegal activity

details: Article from The New York Times
Includes expert analysis from tax professionals

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be a published New York Times investigative article about Donald Trump's tax practices during the 1990s casino era

analysis.summary: This New York Times article investigates Donald Trump's use of a legally dubious tax avoidance maneuver in the early 1990s that allowed him to avoid paying hundreds of millions in federal income taxes while losing investors' money on his Atlantic City casino empire, with tax experts stating the strategy pushed beyond recognized tax loopholes.
